ygData.subject: Re: What a beautiful day!
ygData.msgSnippet: Oops sorry, the other had the full message still in it (ack!) ... down, you get a real nice piece of small magical ringmail... (Dwarven Ringmail Tunic) ...
ygData.messageBody:
Oops sorry, the other had the full message still in it (ack!)

>Emperor Crush - The dude that runs the whole show. If you take him
down, you get a real nice piece >of small magical ringmail...

(Dwarven Ringmail Tunic)
>Royal Guard - A orc ROGUE if you believe it...I do, because his
backstab is brutal>Lord Darish - Haven't met up with him often (Even as
my level 15 Warrior alter ego) Not sure what >good he is...

I believe Darish also carries some special axe, although I'm not
certian. he spawns in the "throne room"
>The Prophet - An oracle on steroids...

The scariest thing is The Prophet does is buff DVinn and Crush with
Spirit of the Wolf. I had no idea he was doing this when I'd been to CB
before, and I remember being mowed down by a train of Dvinn, Crush, etc.
when I was in CB at lower levels. It's a pretty nasty thing of him to
do. ;p He sometimes has Tergon's Spellbook, a lore item. I believe this
is for a quest. >Emisarry - The orc with a mission...To whack you over
and over and over with his spear. Really, he's >quite good at his
job...>Ambassador D'vinn - Dark Elf with an attitude. This is THE bad
guy of the whole area. Not sure >what level he is, but it usually takes
a group to nuke him. Awesome dagger (Dragoon Dirk) to be
>found when he falls though (Hint: If you're not on his hate list, don't
attack orcs near him...He might >ignore you if you're not fighting!)

Dvinn seems to also have a racial hatred toward Wood Elves, as does Dorn
in the 2nd Northern Ro Dervish Camp. Maybe the hatred is toward bards,
but I'm inclined to believe it's actually Wood Elves. Perhaps all Dark
Elves (NPCs) have this dislike? BTW, Dvinn ALWAYS has the dagger, so at
least you know if you actually do beat him, you will get it. It is also
now a Lore Item, which is a good change to reduce overt camping in my
opinion. DVinn often has the Black Heart for the Paladin Quest, but not
always.


I went to Crushbone the other day at Level 19, and Crushbone was a blue
con but to me was like fighting 2 dervish thugs at 17th or 18th, I
couldn't take him alone. The Prophet was VERY easy to kill. Dvinn -
don't even consider it. I paired up with a L24 druid the first go around
to get a Dragoon Dirk, and the only reason Dvinn died was because the
druid was a monster. DVinn was 19th-20th everytime we spawned. Even
splitting the exp with a L24, I got literally a quarter bubble exp off
of him. The Dragoon Dirk however is an awesome weapon, and is even
better then the Combine long sword I used. It seems with alot of these
that bronze armor puts you over the edge in taking hits from them, I was
still in 90% banded when I went, and wielded a Combine LS and a FS LS.
>These two are found elsewhere and are of note, because they can get
hard to kill at lower levels... >Trainer - Found WAY on top of the hill
overlooking the castle. People camp this area heavily >because he will
drop a Shiny Brass Shield (AC10, +10vsMagic, Lightstone)>Taskmaster -
Slaver Boss. Has a nice leather whip to reach out and touch someone
with...Actually >found behind the castle.>Rondo - Dwarven Bandit found
in the mines. He appears to be cooperating with the orcs. Good >reason
to ice him. >If you give a slave a copper piece, he will read the number
of his shackles so you can match the keys up....

WOW! I didn't know about the copper. Now I can go use those keys I've
been collecting in the bank. Great tip.

There is also a very rare spawn called "the warlord", he can have a
Bracer of Battle. It's a very good piece of armor I hear in its own
right, but you also need it to complete the quest for the screaming
mace, along with the shiny brass shield.

Ariell Thunderwolf, Karana
